Scrambled Net

Connect the terminals to the server by rotating the tiles. Touch a tile to rotate it, or select and click with the trackball; press and hold a tile to lock it when you think it's correct.

 With a keyboard, you can press Z, N or 4 to rotate a tile left; M, X or 6 to rotate right; and press space or 0 to lock.

 Tiles which are connected are shown highlighted. Use the menu to select different skill levels, pause the game, or start a new game.

Tap the screen to start.

At Insane level, the board edges wrap around; cells on the right edge connect to those on the left edge, and vice versa. Similarly for the top and bottom edges. But in addition, in cells with 3 or 4 connections, the wiring is invisible. Good luck!

Scrambled Net, and Android puzzle game by Ian Cameron Smith. Inspired by KNetwalk by Andi Peredri, Thomas Nagy, and Reinhold Kainhofer. Includes MTRandom by David Beaumont.
